Description.val:
The FY 2021 funding request was reduced by $2.000 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

This budget provides funding for targeted modernization of various HM&E systems on board the LHD and LHA class Amphibious Assault Ships. Some major modernization efforts include the procurement and installation of Brushless Generators for the PMP, main feed pump replacement; and Shipboard Air Traffic Control Communications (SATCC), Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS), and Ballast and DC Console.

Brushless Generator replacement will reduce down time, total ownership costs, and maintenance costs associated with antiquated brush type generators. Main feed pump procurement and install replaces obsolete main feed pumps for the main propulsion boiler. Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS) provides a network infrastructure for HM&E systems.

Justification.val: Funds provide for the modernization of Amphibious Assault Ships.

Name.@footnote: This solution proposed would implement HM&E principles, it would implement a Defense-in-Depth Functional Implementation Architecture (DFIA) and meet the requirements of the standards released by the Information Assurance Technical Authority Board (IA TAB) across all the H,M&E systems deploying the ability to protect, detect, react, and restore in a contested environment.  The HM&E Condition System will monitor the signals on the HM&E network, both between HM&E systems and also those coming from other functional domains.

ModificationTitle.val: LH001 - LHD Midlife, Brushless Generator for PMP

Title.val: LH001 - LHD Midlife, Brushless Generator for PMP

Name.@footnote: Installation funding for a ship is divided over a three-year period. Installation execution funding in the year of availability, and Design Service Allocation (DSA) two years prior to availability, and DSA in the year prior to the availability.  This includes ship checks, ship installation drawing (SID) development, logistic document development and long lead time material procurements (LLTM).  Installation costs across the FYDP may vary depending on current port rates. Port rates are updated every year by a CNRMC letter based on the forecasted port loading model. Port loading rate forecasts are the rates recommended for all budgeted maintenance and organic modernization within a specific port. Individual ship's availability durations vary dependent upon the integration of ship's maintenance and modernization work packages.  The Brushless Generator procurement made in FY17 was planned for installation during LHD 2s FY19 PMA.  The installation during the FY19 PMA was deferred, as the availability length could not support the duration of the installation.  The installation of this unit is now planned for LHD 2s FY22 DPMA.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT/Industrial:: Installation Name: Brushless Generator for PMP

Description.val:
The Brushless Generator replacement will reduce down time, total ownership costs, and maintenance costs associated with antiquated brush type generators.

Brushless Generator Upgrade replaces a LHD's (5) brush-type Ship's Service Turbine Generators that are plagued by severe reliability, maintenance and obsolescence problems. Brushless Generator Upgrade will reduce both S/F and depot level maintenance requirements, and increase a LHD's electric plant Operational Availability (Ao).

Name.@footnote: Funding is for procurement and installation of MFP equipment to address system obsolescence by installing an industry supported, steam driven pump with a new electronic automatic boiler control that will prevent over-speed conditions, which is a major cause of MFP failures. The new pump will improve reliability, operational availability and bring commonality with other ship classes.  Installation funding for a ship is divided over a three-year period. Installation execution funding in the year of availability, and Design Service Allocation (DSA) two years prior to availability, and DSA in the year prior to the availability.  This includes ship checks, ship installation drawing (SID) development, logistic document development and long lead time material procurements (LLTM).  Installation costs across the FYDP may vary depending on current port rates. Port rates are updated every year by a CNRMC letter based on the forecasted port loading model. Port loading rate forecasts are the rates recommended for all budgeted maintenance and organic modernization within a specific port. Individual ship's availability durations vary dependent upon the integration of ship's maintenance and modernization work packages.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Industrial:: Installation Name: Main Feed Pump

Description.val:
Main Feed Pump (MFP) replacement addresses system obsolescence by installing an industry supported, steam driven pump with a new electronic automatic boiler control that will prevent over-speed conditions, which is a major cause of MFP failures.  The new pump will improve reliability, operational availability and bring commonality with other ship classes.
Engineering Services required in year prior to install.

Name.@footnote: The installation costs are higher for the PY procurement in comparison to future procurements due to port manday rates being different.    Funding is for procurement and installation of SATCC to provide highly reliable Air Traffic Control (ATC) voice communications between pilots and ATC team, command and control, and connection to administrative jdial services throughout the ship. This installs a ruggedized, Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) system that addresses Safety of Flight concerns due to cumbersome communication controls that degrades ATC's situational awareness during flight operations.  Installation costs across the FYDP may vary depending on current port rates. Port rates are updated every year by a CNRMC letter based on the forecasted port loading model. Port loading rate forecasts are the rates recommended for all budgeted maintenance and organic modernization within a specific port. Individual ship's availability durations vary dependent upon the integration of ship's maintenance and modernization work packages.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Shipboard Air Traffic Control Communication (SATCC)

Description.val: Shipboard Air Traffic Control Communication (SATCC) provides highly reliable Air Traffic Control (ATC) voice communications between pilots and ATC team, command and control, and connection to administrative jdial services throughout the ship.  This installs a ruggedized, Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) system that addresses Safety of Flight concerns due to cumbersome communication controls that degrades ATC's situational awareness during flight operations.  This install will establish commonality across CVN, LHD and LHA classes.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Industrial:: Installation Name: Navigation Critical Data Distribution (NavCrit)

Description.val: The Navigation Critical Distribution System (NCDS) procurements will be installed on LHD Class ships to replace and consolidate current analog Interior Communications (IC) data signals on the MK 70 and IC Switchboards, as well as analog indicators throughout the ships. The removal of the AN/USQ-82(V) Shipboard Data Multiplexer System (SDMS) will also be included. Network switches will be installed to provide data transmission from the NAVSSI Real Time Subsystem (RTS) to all clients and devices that require navigation data. Input Output Controllers (IOC) will be installed to convert the Navigation Sensor System Interface (NAVSSI) Standard Navigation Message from Ethernet to the required analog signal.  Programmable Logic Controllers will be installed to handle all Navigation related alarms. Navigation Displays and Navigation Management Data Terminals (Alarm Panels) will be installed in various locations to provide the NAVCERT required data and alarms in the appropriate locations. A distributed IRIG-B timing architecture is also included, which includes IRIG-B clocks.

Name.val: 1.1.1) Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS) procurement - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: Industrial:: Installation Name: Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS) procurement

Description.val: [Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS) procurement] Description:  Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS) provides a network infrastructure for Hull, Mechanical & Electrical Systems to operate on that provides the operator necessary situational awareness of the engineering plant.  It will improve functionality for Fluid Control Systems (FCS), Fire Protection Systems and Interior Communication/System Monitoring (IC/SM) alarm switchboard, which are severely degraded or inoperable across the LHD Class due to obsolescence.  PACS must be installed prior to or conjunctively with Damage Control/Ballast Control Console Upgrade, which is a Class Safety Alteration.

Name.val: 1.1.1) Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Control) - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Control)

Description.val: Description: Power Management Platform (PMP) modernization converts legacy analog controls to a digital automated control system. This system gathers and combines all Electric plant data that can be monitored at different control stations throughout the engineering plant ensuring redundancy of the system.  PMP simplifies multiple control sequences into single step operations, making possible new control capabilities that were too cumbersome for operators to perform.  PMP implements a gradual Ship Service Turbine Generator (SSTG) turbine startup/shutdown sequence which allows the turbine to achieve stabilized temperatures more consistently, reducing operational stress on components and improves reliability and operational availability of the system.  PMP automation will reduce electrical system transients and stress on breaker components by employing a Zero Power Transfer (ZPT) strategy, which limits the current flow through an individual breaker to zero during open/close evolutions.  During PMP installation obsolete switchboard breakers will be replaced with Commercial Off-the-Shelf (COTS) Whipp and Bourne circuit breakers that will improve navy total ownership by increasing commonality across the fleet and reducing preventative and corrective maintenance.

Description.val: Hierarchical Yet Dynamically Reprogrammable Architecture (HYDRA) modernization replaces the unsupported P7100/MRK fixed and portable radios with new XG-75 radios and Radiating Transmission Lines (RTL) that incorporates industry standard Association of Public Safety Communications Official (APCO) P-25 signaling protocols.  The new system with maintain vital, below deck, wireless communications that enable ship's force to coordinate amphibious, aviation, force protection and damage control operations safely.  HYDRA modernization will establish commonality across CG, CVN, LPD and LSD Ship Classes.

Name.val: 2.1.1) BALLAST AND DC CONSOLE PROCUREMENT - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: BALLAST AND DC CONSOLE PROCUREMENT

Description.val:
[BALLAST AND DC CONSOLE PROCUREMENT] Description:  Ballast and Damage Control Console install will replace the existing operator consoles for Ballasting, Firemain, Firefighting, and AFFF Systems with Commercial off-the-Shelf, dual screen consoles and Operator Interface Panels.  These consoles have been plagued by power supply assemblies and circuit card obsolescence, which has made these system degraded from their normal capability reducing watch stander situational awareness. This install is a Class safety alt to prevent casualties such as Ballast tank over pressurization and flooding as seen on LHD 1 in FY15. 

60% of Engineering Services required 2 years prior to install, 40% required 1-year prior to install.

Name.@footnote: Alteration NRE required to support first in class install.

Installation/procurement costs vary because the scope of work on LHD8, LHA 6-7 varies from LHD 1-7.  Installation funding for a ship is divided over a three-year period. ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: SCS- GOV PROCUREMENT

Description.val:
(P40A) SCS-GOV (LHD7/8, LHA 6/7): The Ship Control System-Government (SCS-GOV) supports the standardization of hardware, software and design of the surface ship Ship Control Systems (SCS) to address hardware and software obsolescence issues. The installation will bring commonality across the LHD 1-8 and LHA-6 hulls.  SCS-GOV replaces the analog Ship Control System (SCS) with a digital SCS. Analog systems are very maintenance intensive constantly requiring alignment of the amplifiers, indicators, and other transmitting devices. The existing system is also largely obsolete requiring cannibalization from decommissioned ships.

[SCS- GOV PROCUREMENT]

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: AMLIFIED ANNOUNCING SYSTEM PROCUREMENTS

Description.val: General Announcing upgrade replaces the obsolete 1/2/3/5/6/10MC Announcing Systems with a common, survival Digital Integrated Announcing System (DIAS), which has been installed on the DDG and CG Classes during midlife modernization.  Existing announcing systems are riddled with obsolescence that degrades performance and presents a safety concern, during shipboard operations and casualties.  This is a capability required in the LHD Required Operational Capabilities (ROC) document.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: ICT UPGRADE (SCD14785) PROCUREMENT

Description.val: Integrated Communication Terminals (ICT) upgrade replaces the antiquated system with a Commercial off-the-Shelf digital system that improves both internal and external communications with the ship necessary to meeting USMC requirements for executing operations.  The system incorporates hardware installed on the LCS, CVN-78 and CVN-68 classes, reducing supportability and training requirements for the fleet.  This upgrade is necessary for Digital Conference Switch System (DCSS) and Integrated Voice Network System upgrades to be implemented.

Description.val: [IVCN Tech Refresh] Integrated Voice Communications Network (IVCN) Tech Refresh unifies three obsolete communication servers into a single, redundant distributed IP network that will enable expanded communication capabilities for command and control.  The refresh will incorporate a wireless, digital telephone system that will improve coordination between shipboard personnel.

Name.@footnote: MCS requires sufficient upfront cost for non-reoccurring engineering services because of the significant amount of control the system provides to 37-subsystems throughout the ship via 10,000 different signals.  The NRE will be utilized for first article environmental quality testing of 12 different components and establishment of an MCS Land Based Test Facility that will be required for software development for future availabilities and be leveraged for system engineering for milestone review and Cyber Security hardening under the Risk Management Framework. Description.val: Machinery Control System (MCS) will replace the existing obsolete Versa Module Europa (VME) server with Windows XP operating system (O/S) that was purchased in the mid-2000s as part of the ship construction award for LHD8 and LHA6.  Both the hardware and software are no longer supported by industry and require a complete replacement.  MCS will leverage existing infrastructure replacing internal hardware to the existing system's severs.  LHD8, LHA 6-7 will receive a Versatile Performance Switching (VPX) server with Windows 10, or future O/S that provides improved bandwidth for control of the ship's 37 vital engineering systems, while maintain margin for new capabilities to be introduced.  The new system provides room for growth and flexibility to easily incorporate emerging cyber security requirements that will help prevent adversarial threats.
